benchmark_details.name: EVALUATING LARGE LANGUAGE MODELS ON THE GMAT
benchmark_details.overview: This study introduces the first benchmark to assess the performance of seven major LLMs on the GMAT, which is a key exam in the admission process for graduate business programs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the efficacy of LLMs on the Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) and examine their capabilities and limitations in educational environments.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The scope of the study is limited to multiple-choice questions from the quantitative reasoning and verbal reasoning sections of the GMAT.

data.source: Official GMAT practice exams sourced from the Graduate Management Admission Council (GMAC).

methodology.calculation: The overall average accuracy is calculated by dividing the number of correct answers by the total number of questions across all three exam sets for each model.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy scores indicate better performance on the exam.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4 Turbo achieved an average accuracy of 85.07%.
methodology.validation: The models were tested on both free and premium GMAT exams to ensure comprehensive evaluation.

targeted_risks.harm: Potentially providing incorrect or misleading information that could affect learning.
